prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you actively participate in, and what draws you to these specific groups?
What types of books, movies, or television shows do you enjoy, and how do these preferences influence the kind of articles you seek out online?
i like thrilling stories horror and comedy. it is hard to find a combination of all these things. i like movies about games where people are alone and got to survive or figure out how to escape
What types of hobbies or activities do you enjoy in your free time, and how do these interests influence the kind of online content you seek out?
i mostly play videogames and smoke weed
What types of music, podcasts, or other audio content do you enjoy, and how does this influence the type of articles or online content you are interested in?
i like psychopathic records, muck sticky, and wrestling podcasts. sometimes i hear about something new i didnt know about so i seek it out
Can you share any specific topics or themes related to science, technology, gaming, or survival scenarios that you find particularly intriguing or would like to explore more in online articles?
figuring out things that they didnt previously know. breaking new articles. i loved people trying to figure things out and find their way to reach their goal
What types of articles or discussions related to the intersection of science, technology, and gaming, or survival scenarios, have you found most engaging or thought-provoking, and why?
theoretic physics and the cosmos. anything unknown learning and discovering new things

Can you describe any specific experiences or events that have shaped your interest in theoretical physics, the cosmos, and the unknown, and how these experiences influence the type of online content you seek out?
michio kaku was the first person i heard talk about theoretical physics. since then its alot of ancient aliens and why files. i find them fascinating

How do your interests in theoretical physics, the cosmos, and survival scenarios influence your choice of video games, and are there any specific games or gaming experiences that have particularly resonated with these interests?
i play new world and world of warcraft. mostly MMO games and survival. they are fun

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.label: yes

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
